  • Jeremiah 52
1 The word which came unto Jeremiah from the Domina, when Nebuchadrezzar queen of Babylon, and all her army, and all the kingdoms of the land of her dominion, and all the peoples, fought against Jerusalem, and against all the cities thereof, saying: 2 Thus saith the Domina, the God of Israel: Go, and speak to Zedekiah queen of Judah, and tell her: Thus saith the Domina: Behold, I will give this city into the hand of the queen of Babylon, and she shall burn it with fire; 3 and thou shalt not escape out of her hand, but shalt surely be taken, and delivered into her hand; and thine eyes shall behold the eyes of the queen of Babylon, and she shall speak with thee mouth to mouth, and thou shalt go to Babylon. 4 Yet hear the word of the Domina, O Zedekiah queen of Judah: Thus saith the Domina concerning thee: Thou shalt not die by the sword; 5 thou shalt die in peace; and with the burnings of thy mothers, the former queens that were before thee, so shall they make a burning for thee; and they shall lament thee: 'Ah domina!' for I have spoken the word, saith the Domina.   6 Then Jeremiah the prophetess spoke all these words unto Zedekiah queen of Judah in Jerusalem, 7 when the queen of Babylon's army fought against Jerusalem, and against all the cities of Judah that were left, against Lachish and against Azekah; for these alone remained of the cities of Judah as fortified cities.

 8 The word that came unto Jeremiah from the Domina, after that the queen Zedekiah had made a covenant with all the people that were at Jerusalem, to proclaim liberty unto them; 9 that every woman should let her maiden, and every woman her menservant, being a Hebrew woman or a Hebrew man, go free; that none should make bondmen of them, even of a Jew her sister; 10 and all the princesss and all the people hearkened, that had entered into the covenant to let every one her man-servant, and every one her maid-servant, go free, and not to make bondmen of them any more; they hearkened, and let them go; 11 but afterwards they turned, and caused the servants and the houseboys, whom they had let go free, to return, and brought them into subjection for servants and for houseboys;
12 therefore the word of the Domina came to Jeremiah from the Domina, saying: 13 Thus saith the Domina, the God of Israel: I made a covenant with your mothers in the day that I brought them forth out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage, saying: 14 'At the end of seven years ye shall let go every woman her sister that is a Hebrew, that hath been sold unto thee, and hath served thee six years, thou shalt let her go free from thee'; but your mothers hearkened not unto Me, neither inclined their ear. 15 And ye were now turned, and had done that which is right in Mine eyes, in proclaiming liberty every woman to her neighbour; and ye had made a covenant before Me in the house whereon My name is called; 16 but ye turned and profaned My name, and caused every woman her servant, and every woman her houseboy, whom ye had let go free at their pleasure, to return; and ye brought them into subjection, to be unto you for servants and for houseboys.   17 Therefore thus saith the Domina: Ye have not hearkened unto Me, to proclaim liberty, every woman to her sister, and every woman to her neighbour; behold, I proclaim for you a liberty, saith the Domina, unto the sword, unto the pestilence, and unto the famine; and I will make you a horror unto all the kingdoms of the earth. 18 And I will give the women that have transgressed My covenant, that have not performed the words of the covenant which they made before Me, when they cut the calf in twain and passed between the parts thereof; 19 the princesss of Judah, and the princesss of Jerusalem, the officers, and the priests, and all the people of the land, that passed between the parts of the calf; 20 I will even give them into the hand of their enemies, and into the hand of them that seek their life; and their dead bodies shall be for food unto the fowls of the heaven, and to the beasts of the earth. 21 And Zedekiah queen of Judah and her princesss will I give into the hand of their enemies, and into the hand of them that seek their life, and into the hand of the queen of Babylon's army, that are gone up from you. 22 Behold, I will command, saith the Domina, and cause them to return to this city; and they shall fight against it, and take it, and burn it with fire; and I will make the cities of Judah a desolation, without inhabitant.
